    ComponentListener, HierarchyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible

    public class LayerViewGL4Canvas
extends LayerViewGLCanvas
implements ComponentListener
    Author:
    JeT GL drawable canvas inserted into a LayerViewLwjglPanel

      • getFboPingPongTextureId1

        public int getFboPingPongTextureId1()
        Get the GL id of the first texture used by the ping-pong mecanism of the FBO. Creates a new id if there is none.
        Returns:
        the Gl id of the first ping-pong texture.

      • getFboPingPongTextureId2

        public int getFboPingPongTextureId2()
        Get the GL id of the second texture used by the ping-pong mecanism of the FBO. Creates a new id if there is none.
        Returns:
        the Gl id of the second ping-pong texture.

      • invalidateFBO

        public final void invalidateFBO()
        Reset the FBO size. Used to invalidate the FBO.

      • getFBOImageWidth

        public final int getFBOImageWidth()
        Returns:
        the width of the current FBO texture.

      • getFBOImageHeight

        public final int getFBOImageHeight()
        Returns:
        the height of the current FBO.

      • updateFBODimensions

        public final void updateFBODimensions()
        The dimensions of the FBO depends on the canvas size and are multiplied by the current antialiazing_size+1.

      • initializeFBO

        public void initializeFBO()
                   throws GLException
        Init or refresh the FBO textures and properties. A FBO is refreshed whenever the canvas size or the antialiazing levels change. Also, initializeFBO() set the FBO as the current active FrameBuffer.
        Throws:
        GLException

      • readFromPingPong

        public void readFromPingPong(GLProgram program)
                      throws GLException
        Allow to read the ping-pong textures stored by the FBO. Depending on the current ping-pong state, the first or second ping-pong texture will be activated and set to the given GLProgram.
        Parameters:
        program - the GLProgram that will use the FBO ping-pong texture
        Throws:
        GLException

      • drawInPingPong

        public void drawInPingPong(GLProgram program)
                    throws GLException
        Allow a GLProgram to use the ping-pong textures of the FBO. Depending on the current ping-pong state, the first or the second ping-pong texture will be set. This method is used to draw the current ping-pong texture into the final FBO texture to eventually display.
        Parameters:
        program - the GLProgram that will use the FBO ping-pong texture
        Throws:
        GLException

      • clearCurrentPingPongFBO

        public void clearCurrentPingPongFBO()
                             throws GLException
        Clear the ping-pong texture correponding to the current ping-pong state.
        Throws:
        GLException
